byline.original: By MIKHAIL GORBACHEV, JANE GOODALL, PARKER LIAUTAUD, JAMIE OLIVER and PHILIPPE COUSTEAU Jr

docs.lead_paragraph: Mikhail Gorbachev Green Cross International founding president and the last leader of the Soviet Union.
docs.snippet: Will the planet be a better or worse place halfway through the 21st century? We put the question to five world-watchers.

headline.print_headline: Phys Ed: Can Athletes Benefit From a Vegan Diet?
headline.main: Can Athletes Perform Well on a Vegan Diet?

docs.abstract: Is going totally meatless and dairy-free advisable for serious athletes -- or for the rest of us who just want to be healthy and fit? Gretchen Reynolds talks with three fitness experts.
docs.snippet: Is going totally meatless and dairy-free advisable for serious athletes -- or for the rest of us who just want to be healthy and fit? Gretchen Reynolds talks with three fitness experts.

headline.main: Progress Is Our Most Important Product

docs.abstract: An optimistic curmudgeon reports on the good things happening in food trends and policy.
docs.snippet: An optimistic curmudgeon reports on the good things happening in food trends and policy.

docs.abstract: The world could stand to shed a few pounds. Fifteen million metric tons, actually, a new study estimates.
docs.snippet: The world could stand to shed a few pounds. Fifteen million metric tons, actually, a new study estimates.

headline.main: Diabetes Linked to Memory Problems in Older Adults

docs.abstract: A new study adds to growing evidence that the complications of diabetes may extend to the brain, causing declines in memory, attention and other cognitive skills.
docs.snippet: A new study adds to growing evidence that the complications of diabetes may extend to the brain, causing declines in memory, attention and other cognitive skills.

headline.seo: Studies of Human Microbiome Yield New Insights

docs.abstract: Emerging doctrine known as 'medical ecology' seeks to promote a more subtle approach to managing the body's trillions of microbes, eschewing the indiscriminate use of antibiotics; proponents received a major boost from the National Human Genome Research Institute's Human Microbiome Project, which sequenced genetic material of bacteria recovered from human beings, revealing some of the ways in which these invisible residents shape human life.
docs.lead_paragraph: As we learn more about the trillions of microbes we carry around, some scientists want to be like wildlife managers — nurturing the good and weeding out the bad.
docs.snippet: As we learn more about the trillions of microbes we carry around, some scientists want to be like wildlife managers — nurturing the good and weeding out the bad.

headline.print_headline: Is a Ban on Large Sodas the Answer to Obesity?
headline.main: Is a Ban on Large Sodas the Answer to Obesity?

docs.lead_paragraph: Readers discuss Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s proposal.
docs.snippet: Readers discuss Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s proposal.

headline.seo: In Health Care Ruling, Vast Implications for Medicaid
headline.print_headline: In Health Care Ruling, Vast Implications for Medicaid
headline.main: In Health Care Ruling, Vast Implications for Medicaid

docs.abstract: Supreme Court ruling on the new health care law will have vast implications for Medicaid and the 250,000 people who will benefit from the expansion of the program in Arkansas alone; state officials everywhere worry about the costs associated with expanding Medicaid programs, and one of the aspects of the law that the Supreme Court is deliberating on is the ability of Congress to attach conditions to money it distributes to states.
docs.lead_paragraph: The expansion of Medicaid in the health care law, if it is upheld, would greatly increase the number of people served — and add to the program’s costs.
docs.snippet: The expansion of Medicaid in the health care law, if it is upheld, would greatly increase the number of people served — and add to the program’s costs.
